CatDescriptText: Lewis E. Green, postal worker, Pittsburgh, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, March 19, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you approve of teachers paddling children?"  Answer reads: "I think so.  In my day they did.  Some persons have to be disciplined that way."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of man wearing cap with X pattern, dark leather jacket, and light colored scarf, standing in front of lighting store; Portrait of Lewis E. Green wearing dark fedora and light colored buttoned overcoat, standing in front of lighting store
